function.name: search_products
function.description: Search for products based on various criteria such as color, size, category, price range, and brand, to find specific Stock Keeping Units (SKUs) or general Stock Production Units (SPUs).

color.description: The color of the product. This is an optional parameter that can be used to refine SKU searches.

size.description: The size of the product. This is an optional parameter that can be used to refine SKU searches.

category.description: The category of the product, such as 'electronics', 'clothing', or 'furniture'. This parameter is required for both SPU and SKU level searches.

price_min.description: The minimum price of the product search. Enter a float value representing the lowest price in dollars.

price_max.description: The maximum price of the product search. Enter a float value representing the highest price in dollars.

brand.description: The brand of the product. This is an optional parameter for searching within a specific brand.

detailLevel.description: The level of detail required for the product information. Use 'SKU' for size and color details.

material.description: The material of the product. This parameter is optional and can be used to filter product details.

care_instructions.description: Whether to include care instructions in the product details. If true, care instructions will be included.

function.name: send_message
function.description: Sends a personalized message to a human user, including support for Unicode characters such as emojis.

message.description: The content of the message to be sent to the user. Supports all Unicode characters, including emojis.

recipient.description: The identifier of the message recipient, such as an email address or a phone number, in the format 'name@example.com' or '+12345678900'.

priority.description: The priority level of the message.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the message should be sent, formatted as 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' in UTC. If not specified, the message will be sent immediately.

function.name: pause_heartbeats
function.description: Temporarily suspends the processing of timed heartbeats for a specified duration. Manual heartbeats and other event processing will continue as normal.

minutes.description: The duration in minutes for which heartbeats should be ignored. Must be a positive integer and less than or equal to 3600 minutes (equivalent to 60 hours).

include_manual.description: A flag to determine if manual heartbeats should also be ignored. By default, only timed heartbeats are paused.

function.name: message_chatgpt
function.description: Sends a message to ChatGPT, a basic AI model, designed to respond to queries without retaining memory of prior interactions. Useful for one-time questions and instructions.

message.description: The message to be sent to ChatGPT. It should be a well-formed English sentence.

request_heartbeat.description: Determines whether an immediate heartbeat is requested post-execution, facilitating subsequent messages or functions. When true, it implies readiness for further interaction.

function.name: core_memory_append
function.description: Appends a specified content to a section of the core memory. Supports all Unicode characters, including emojis.

name.description: The section of the memory to be edited. Valid sections are 'persona' for character traits and 'human' for human-like experiences.

content.description: The content to append to the memory. Can include any Unicode character, such as text and emojis.

request_heartbeat.description: If true, requests an immediate heartbeat to verify the memory update. Useful for confirming that subsequent messages or functions are executed in response to the update.

function.name: core_memory_replace
function.description: Replaces the contents of a specific section in the core memory. To delete specific memories, provide an empty string for the new_content parameter.

name.description: The section of the memory to be edited. Possible sections include 'persona' or 'human'.

old_content.description: The string to be replaced. This must be an exact match of the memory content to be replaced.

new_content.description: The new content to write into the memory. Supports all Unicode characters, including emojis. Use an empty string ('') to signify memory deletion.

request_heartbeat.description: Requests an immediate heartbeat after the function execution. Set to true to ensure the system is responsive for follow-up actions.

function.name: recall_memory_search
function.description: Search the conversation history for a specific string and return the matching results. This can be used to reference past conversations or retrieve information previously discussed.

query.description: The keyword or phrase to search within the conversation history.

page.description: Defines the page number of the search results to return, allowing pagination through a large set of results. The first page is 0.

request_heartbeat.description: When set to true, triggers an immediate heartbeat after the search function completes. Useful for initiating follow-up actions or checks.

function.name: archival_memory_insert
function.description: This function adds a new entry to the archival memory, ensuring the content is formatted in a manner conducive to future queries and retrievals.

content.description: The information to be archived. Accepts any unicode text, including emojis. Format the content clearly to aid in effective querying.

request_heartbeat.description: When set to true, triggers an immediate heartbeat to confirm successful execution. Useful for initiating follow-up actions.

function.name: archival_memory_search
function.description: Performs a semantic search on archival memory data, utilizing embeddings to find relevant content based on the provided query string.

query.description: The search phrase used to query the archival memory. It should be a coherent string of text.

page.description: Specifies the page number in the search result pagination. It is zero-indexed, where 0 represents the first page.

request_heartbeat.description: Determines whether to request an immediate heartbeat after function execution, useful for initiating a follow-up action.

function.name: http_request
function.description: Generates an HTTP request of a specified type to the provided URL, including an optional payload, and returns the response.

method.description: The HTTP method to be used for the request.

url.description: The target URL for the HTTP request.

payload_json.description: A JSON-formatted string representing the request payload. This should be in a proper JSON structure, encoded as a string.

request_heartbeat.description: If set to true, signals that an immediate heartbeat should be requested after the function's execution. Useful for confirming connectivity or the successful completion of the request.

headers.description: Optional headers to be included in the HTTP request. Common headers include 'Content-Type' and 'Authorization'.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the request body, typically 'application/json'.

Authorization.description: Authentication credentials for the request, such as 'Bearer <token>' or 'Basic <credentials>'.

function.description: Browse attractions in a given city, filtering by entry fee, category, and suitability for children.

location.description: The city or town where the attractions are located, in the format of 'City, State' or 'City, Country'. For example, 'San Francisco, CA' or 'Paris, France'.

free_entry.description: Indicates whether the attraction has free entry. 'True' for free entry, 'False' for paid entry, 'dontcare' for no preference.

category.description: The category of the attraction. Options include religious sites, recreational parks, historical landmarks, etc. 'dontcare' indicates no specific category preference.

good_for_kids.description: Indicates whether the attraction is suitable for children. 'True' means suitable, 'False' means not suitable, 'dontcare' indicates no preference.
